data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To go backward, you must always go left. A sideways walk and a straight walk are not the same. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You cannot turn right after you have left instead of after you started with turn around. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person cannot take more than 6 steps forward and 6 steps backward in the same steps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first person to return from a first step is the person that starts the first step. The second person to return is the person that takes 7 steps, then turns left and takes 5 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 5 steps back for all the steps given.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person can make a turn left and return to the starting point. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
An 8 is just enough to get back to the starting point. The instructions only require that you repeat the steps 6 times. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 1 6 - step = 1 6 - step = 4 6 - step = 10 6 - step = 11 8 - step = 14 8 1 - step = 20 24. You can take 2 4 - step = 5 2 - step = 8 3 is the same as 5 2 - step = 2 So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward in any of these instructions, there is a chance that you may end up back at the starting point. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 7 steps to return to the starting point. Take 2 steps to get to 3rd step. Take 3 steps to return to the starting point. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
One step backward is required to go forward in one motion. In one motion the person faces forward. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, you can return to whatever your starting point is. Taking 1 step backward turns the direction into walking back up. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Just the first part where you're facing forward. The rest of the parts are repeatable. There is a point between the third two parts so you could take 6 steps and start from that point. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you follow the instructions and always face forward then you’ ll always be on the right path. You take 4 steps left. Now when you take 3 steps forward and 1 step right you are back at the beginning point. Thus, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you face forward, you always take 3 steps right. Thus, the answer is Yes.

Turn around right turns right. Take 9 steps to go back to the starting point. Take 9 steps to go back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow this instruction correctly when taking 3 steps, you will be taking 3 + 5 + 6 + 1 steps. If you follow this instruction correctly when taking 6 steps, you will be taking 6 + 3 + 6 + 1 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Steps 12 and 13 are the opposite direction of the starting point. One should turn around and turn right. Thus, the answer is No.

If you take some of these steps in the original directions, you can only get you way back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you want to turn right, you would need to take 7 steps from the starting point to get there. So, the answer is Yes.

There are 3 methods of return to the starting point. Take 1 step. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. Thus, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 5 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 2 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around, take 2 steps, take 5 steps. Take 5 steps in total and return to the starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Turning around and turning around both require 6 steps. If we decide to turn around the first time, then we take 7 steps to get to the starting point. The third and final sequence is a different order of steps. Taking 3 steps, turn around, and turn around would take 6 steps. On the third and final sequence, we would take 7 steps to go back to the starting point. If we know the directions correctly, and we do these exact sequences, then we think we would take 10 steps to return to the starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.

The first move is always forward. The direction is always forward. The second move is always towards the right. The third move is always backward. So, the answer is No.

If you turn around you take four steps back. So, the answer is yes.

There are five pillars of the game. Pointing the finger of your direction, you are always facing forward. If you always face left, you will always go left. If you always face right, you will always go right. The answer: Yes.

If you turn right you will get a five step walk toward it. If you are turning the same way you get the same five step walk toward it. So, the answer is yes.

If you were to start with all 3 steps backward you would start at the starting point. If you are to start with 2 steps forward you would not come back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

First step = forward step followed by step back. 4th step = forward step followed by step back. Take 4th step = downward step followed by step back. So, the answer is No.

A person with a person face forward takes 2 steps forward every step forward. If someone has a person face forward, and takes 4 steps left, and takes 5 steps backward, then a person with a person face forward would take 5 steps backward. They have a person face forward and take 4 steps left. So, the answer is No.

Taking 10 steps backward is the same as taking 8 steps backward. If you take 10 steps forward after 7 steps backward, you are going straight. Taking 10 steps forward is the same as taking 10 steps forward. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 10 steps right. Take 4 steps forward. Take 1 step left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

After going backward, you must go first to the right side of the map. In first step, you must walk left. In second step, you must walk right. To return to the starting point, you must go back to the right side of the map. Thus, the answer is No.
